note_models.name: Basic

fields: Do you know where this Anki deck originated?

This deck is part of an open collaborative effort started by YYC Net Lab. This deck is provided free of charge and without warranty. For updates please see the link below. If you notice any errors or would like to add some cards please reach out to YYC Net Lab through Github.

To stop seeing this card click on 'More' in the bottom right and select 'Suspend Card'.
https://github.com/yycnetlab/ankidecks
How are the cards in this deck tagged?

Cards are tagged with both their technology feature (in the form of FEATURE:<feature>) and with their exam topic (SPRI:<objective> or SPRI:NotTested for topics that are not on the blueprint). Other tags exist, such as "NotForStudy", which defines cards that are references (such as this one).
No reference
How many different types of tags are there for these cards?
3 - feature, exam objective, and miscellaneous tags (e.g. NotForStudy).
No reference
What is the SPRI Exam?
300-510 - CCNP Service Provider (CCNP SP) advanced routing concentration
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/training-events/training-certifications/exams/current-list/spri-300-510.html
What is the exam code for the CCNP SP advanced routing concentration?
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/training-events/training-certifications/exams/current-list/spri-300-510.html
What are the seven LFA repair path attributes?
srlg, repair-path, interface-disjoint, lowest-metric, linecard-disjoint, node-protecting, and broadcast-interface-disjoint
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What would srlg and repair-path be an example of in the context of OSPF LFA?
Repair path attributes
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What feature in EIGRP is OSPF LFA most functionally similar to?
EIGRP feasible successors / EIGRP IP FRR
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
EIGRP feasible successors are most comparable to what OSPF feature?
OSPF Loop-free Alternate (LFA)
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What is the first repair path attribute by order of highest to lowest priority?
Shared Risk Link Groups (SRLGs)
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What order is SRLG in in the priority order for OSPF LFA repair path attributes?
First
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What does OSPF Loop Free Alternate-Fast Reroute (LFA FRR) do in the context of high availability?
Reduce OSPF convergence times by having a "protecting router" storing a precalculated backup path in the RIB and then diverting traffic to it when the primary path fails, thus protecting the path.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What OSPF feature ensures high availability by reducing convergence times by protecting the path to a network?
OSPF Loop Free Alternate-Fast Reroute (LFA FRR)
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What quality of interfaces would you use to determine whether they belong together in a shared risk link group (SRLG)?
Whether they are fate-shared - aka whether they are likely to go down/fail simultaneously, should a failure occur
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
If you have two interfaces that are fate-shared, what type of group should be formed to group those interfaces together for use witH OSPF LFA?
SRLGs - Shared Risk Link Groups
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-3s/iro-xe-3s-book/iro-lfa-frr.html
What BGP feature is OSPF LFA FRR similar to?
BGP Prefix Independent Convergence (PIC) - aka bgp add-path
http://brbccie.blogspot.com/2014/09/ospf-lfa-remote-lfa.html
What OSPF feature is BGP PIC most related to?
OSPF LFA FRR - Loop-Free Alternate Fast Reroute
http://brbccie.blogspot.com/2014/09/ospf-lfa-remote-lfa.html
How would you configure a BGP dynamic neighbor for 10.0.0.0/24 for all ASes in the AS-list TEST?
neighbor 10.0.0.0/24 remote-as-list TEST

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/iosxr/ncs5500/bgp/63x/b-bgp-cg-ncs5500-63x/b-bgp-cg-ncs5500-63x_chapter_0101.html#:~:text=watch%20timeout%20Close-,BGP%20Dynamic%20Neighbors,as%20a%20subnet%20IP%20address.
What feature does the command neighbor x.x.x.x/y configure in IOS-XR?
BGP dynamic neighbors

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/iosxr/ncs5500/bgp/63x/b-bgp-cg-ncs5500-63x/b-bgp-cg-ncs5500-63x_chapter_0101.html#:~:text=watch%20timeout%20Close-,BGP%20Dynamic%20Neighbors,as%20a%20subnet%20IP%20address.
In IOS-XR, what command would you issue to convert a default-configuration IS to Level-1-2?
Nothing - routers are, by default, Level-1-2.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/xr12000/software/xr12k_r4-0/routing/configuration/guide/rc40xr12k_chapter3.html
T/F: In IOS-XR, routers are Level-1-2 by default with IS-IS.
True
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/xr12000/software/xr12k_r4-0/routing/configuration/guide/rc40xr12k_chapter3.html
What are the maximum number of IS-IS LSPs that a router can generate?
4 - A router that is the designated intermediate system (DIS) on the segment for both L1 and L2 generates 4 LSPs - two regular router LSPs: L1/L2 and two psuedonode LSPs: L1/L2
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/xr12000/software/xr12k_r4-0/routing/configuration/guide/rc40xr12k_chapter3.html
A router has generated 4 LSPs in the LSPDB - what does this reveal about the router?
It is a Level-1-2 IS-Type and is the DIS for both levels.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/xr12000/software/xr12k_r4-0/routing/configuration/guide/rc40xr12k_chapter3.html
